results.title: ACMI Presents: Legends of Australian Animation
results.brief_description:
To celebrate ‘DreamWorks Animation: The Exhibition’, ACMI decided it was a wonderful opportunity to invite five internationally-lauded Australian auteur animators to join us in a celebration of their careers, and to talk about the Australian animation industry.
Oscar winners and nominees Adam Elliot, Bruce Petty, Shaun Tan, Anthony Lucas and Sejong Park share their experiences, expertise and perspectives on their craft, their career histories and their production processes.
The panel was hosted by Melbourne cinematic stalwart Tait Brady.

results.title: Disney Masterclass with Roy Conli and Glen Keane
results.brief_description:
Disney Animator Glen Keane and Producer Roy Conli presented a special Masterclass sharing their behind-the-scenes insights and love of the animation process.
Glen Keane has been with the Walt Disney Studios for over 25 years and is best known for his character animations for feature films such as ‘The Little Mermaid’, ‘Aladdin’, ‘Beauty and the Beast’, ‘Tarzan’, and ‘Tangled’. He reflects on the inspirations for some of his characters and expressing yourself through drawing.
Roy Conli is the producer of the Disney feature animated film, ‘Tangled’, based on the story of Rapunzel. He explains the role of the producer and the line between creating a safe and fertile environment for artists and getting a film made on time and within budget.

results.title: The Leaving of Liverpool: Part 1
results.creator_credit: Steve Knapman, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, ABC-TV (Australia), BBC, Michael Jenkins and John Alsop
results.brief_description:
Two English children - Lily (Christine Tremarco) and Bert (Kevin Jones) meet at the Star of the Sea orphanage in Liverpool. Lily has been placed there by her impoverished mother who needs to get on her feet financially, her pain at being separated is eased when she meets the spritely and nationalistic Bert. Together with the shy, hearing impaired Wilson (David Kaff), the three children decide to fly the flag for the empire and agree to go to Australia, their heads filled with ideas of forming a unified family in a warmer climate. This first part of the miniseries principally traces the fortunes of Wilson and Bert. Separated from Lily on arrival in Australia, they are taken to a religious rural establishment, St Bedes, where the boys are faced with gruelling manual labour, and a lack of mental stimulation or education. Bert is befriended by Brother O’Neill, while Wilson is subject to bullying.

From 1945, 10,000 children such as Lily and Bert were sent to Australia, under a child migration system which saw the removal of 130,000 youngsters from Britain. The program took place until 1967.

This version of events led to some of the migrants coming forward with their stories of abuse and neglect. Dubbed ‘The Forgotten Australians’, an official apology was made to them by Prime Minister of Australia, Kevin Rudd, in 2009.

results.title: World Series Debating: That Football is Stupid
results.creator_credit: Joe Murray, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Ted Robinson, Andrew Denton and Wendy Harmer
results.brief_description: One of the most popular events of the annual Melbourne Comedy Festival, the debate was filmed over several years by ABC TV. Campbell McComas introduces two teams of 3 people consisting of Wendy Harmer, Edmund Capon, Lex Marinos, HG Nelson, Laurie Lawrence, Andrew Denton. The topic of this debate is that football is stupid.

results.title: Blue Murder: Part 2
results.creator_credit: Rod Allan, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Film Finance Corporation Australia, Southern Star Entertainment and Michael Jenkins
results.brief_description:
Based on the events that led to the Royal Commission on Police Corruption in New South Wales, ‘Blue Murder’ is a riveting and exceptionally well executed thriller about police corruption and gangland criminal activity in 1980s Australia.
Richard Roxburgh is outstanding as Roger Rogerson, the larrikin police chief who built a lucrative ‘alternative’ career based on bribery, drug money and murder. Tony Martin is Neddy Smith, one of Australia’s most notorious underworld thugs.
Rogerson and Smith’s activities are threatened when a young police officer, Michael Drury (Steve Bastoni), declines a bribe offered to him by Rogerson. From that moment on, ‘Blue Murder’ depicts how Drury’s involvement in acting as an informer on Rogerson’s activities led to increasingly desperate and murderous acts by both police and crims.
Acclaimed internationally as a landmark television mini-series, ‘Blue Murder’ was for years unable to be screened in NSW or available for view on video in Australia due to elements of the story being seen as prejudicial to legal trials in NSW and Federal Courts.
Cast also inlcudes Alex Dimitriades, Peter Phelps and John Hargreaves.
First broadcast (outside NSW) September 21st, 1995.

results.title: Four Corners: The Moonlight State
results.creator_credit: Shaun Hoyt and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Despite denials by the Minister for Local Government Russ Hinze, Police Commissioner Terence Lewis, and Police Minister, Bill Gunn, widespread police corruption is evident throughout Queensland. Brothels masquerading as massage parlours with illegal gambling inhouse and drug trafficking are shown. Persons prominent in the criminal activities are named. This program was a major contributor to the setting up of the Fitzgerald Enquiry into Corruption in Queensland. Presenter: Andrew Olle. Reporter: Chris Masters.
Episode of the ABC TV program Four Corners, aired 11/5/1987.

results.title: Beloved
results.creator_credit: Elle Farnham, Daniel Zinkant, Suited & Booted Studios and First Light
results.brief_description: Through the main protagonist Dave, we hear and see what it is like to be in love and have those feelings trapped inside. As we are let into Dave’s world, we see him and a group of friends as they leave school and embark on their journey home. The film flicks between two worlds of fantasy and real-life as the journey progresses. As the narrative comes to an end, we watch the three friends depart and Dave is left alone. His love unknown, unsaid but only understood by the viewer.

results.title: Pirates of the Indian Ocean
results.creator_credit: Omni Rahman, Enamul Khan, Rafi Rahman, Northamptonshire Bangladeshi Association, Wind & Foster Media and First Light
results.brief_description: Clumsy but lovable DJ duo Mankind and Small-Steps have built a devoted following to their pirate radio show. Raging against the machine in their own inimitable style, will they reach the top of radio programming or be caught on the wrong side of the law before they reach their dream?
